assignments.name: News Report Presentation
assignments.description: Each student will sign up to be a news reporter for one live session during the semester. The report should be a short presentation (1 slide, 5 minutes) that highlights an example of a topic discussed during that module.

assignments.name: Midterm Case Memo
assignments.description: You will write a 6-page memo that analyzes a published case using the concepts from the course, and provides recommendations based on that analysis.

assignments.name: Mini Team Assignments
assignments.description: Throughout the course, you will work in teams and will be given small assignments to prepare in advance of live sessions.

assignments.name: Final Case Presentation
assignments.description: At the end of the course, your team will perform a comprehensive strategic analysis of a company and summarize your findings and recommendations in a final presentation.

assignments.name: Team Member Evaluation
assignments.description: At the end of the course, your teammates will evaluate your contributions to the team’s assignments, and you will do the same for them.

policies.attendance: It is expected that you make an effort to attend live sessions and come ready to participate. Zoom automatically records attendance. Full credit for attendance will only be given to those who stay logged on for the entire live session.
policies.late_work: Assignments received late will be given the following late penalties: 1-3 days late: 5-point deduction; 4-7 days late: 10-point deduction; 8+ days late: half credit. 2 weeks from the original due date is the limit for late submissions.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration, recording, editing, and uploading video via Panopto.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

instructor.name: Ann Murphy, Ph.D.
instructor.office_hours: Tuesdays 3-5pm as well as upon request

_metadata.course_description: An interdisciplinary course which examines the elements of, and the framework for, developing and implementing organizational strategy and policy in competitive environments.
learning_outcomes: Formulate strategic recommendations to help firms create and sustain competitive advantage.
Analyze an organization’s internal and external environments using a variety of quantitative and qualitative tools and techniques.
Discriminate between tactical and strategic approaches to problems, and be able to elevate the approach to be more strategic when necessary.
Leverage technology in both the approach to strategic management analyses as well as in the strategic management solutions for organizations.
Defend strategic analyses and recommendations in individual and group reports and presentations.
